des:
Ingenium Smart Home allows you to control all the devices in your home, both Busing and KNX, using the Alexa assistant 
In order to use Ingenium Smart Home you must have:

• Ingenium screen or web server with internet connection. If you need help connecting your device to the internet, you can find help videos on the youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/ingeniumsl
• Username and password created on said device. If you need help creating a username and password, you can find help videos on the youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/c/ingeniumsl

To get started, select the “Activate skill” button on Alexa to link the Ingenium Smart Home. At this point, you will be prompted to add an Ingenium username and password. You must enter the username and password that have been previously entered in the Ingenium server. You can find more information about connecting smart devices to Alexa here: Connect a Smart Home Device to Alexa (http://tinyurl.com/alexa-smart-home).

Once entered, the devices that can be controlled from the application will appear in Alexa. By clicking on them, you can control them and view their status.

The devices will appear by default with the same names that have been defined on the screen, but these names can be modified from Alexa. Additionally, device groups such as “Bedroom” or “Ground Floor” can be created. More information available at: Create a Smart Home Device Group (http://tinyurl.com/alexa-smart-home-groups)

Once the names of the devices and groups are defined, you can control them by voice using phrases such as the following:
• "Alexa, turn on bedroom"
• "Alexa, move down all the shutters"
• “Alexa, move up the screen 20%”
• “Alexa, set the bedroom thermostat temperature to 22 degrees”
• “Alexa, set the kitchen room to 50%”

Not all Busing and KNX devices are supported, we will continue adding more and more devices in the future.
